intro: Pentameris elegans, commonly known as the elegant pentameris, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
